intro: Dicliptera zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Dicliptera zeylanica is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
